conclusion: Cars A and B are traveling in the same direction on a straight road.
Their v-t graphs are shown in the figure.
It is known that the two cars are side by side at t=30s.
What is the maximum distance between Car A and Car B between the two instances when they are side by side?
Car A has a constant velocity of 40 m/s from t=0 to t=30 seconds.
Car B starts from rest and accelerates uniformly to reach a velocity of 40 m/s at t=20 seconds.
The two cars are side by side at t=30 seconds.
The two cars are also side by side at t=10 seconds.
The farthest distance between them occurs when their speeds are equal, which is at t=20 seconds.
At t=10 seconds, the two cars are side by side.
From t=10 seconds to t=20 seconds, the displacement of Car A is x1=40×10m=400m.
The displacement of Car B is x2=1/2×(20+40)×10m=300m.
The maximum distance between the two cars is Δx=400m−300m=100m.

premise: The maximum distance between the two cars occurs when their speeds are equal, which is at t=20 seconds.
conclusion: The maximum distance between Car A and Car B between the two instances when they are side by side is 100 meters.
